sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": " 

Consider the adjoining figure. It is given that OM is parallel to NP , and MO = 10 cm, MQ = 7 cm, QN = 10 cm, and QP = 11 cm. Now, calculate OQ and NP .
\newline
tikzpicture{}
\newline
[Figure not drawn to scale] \\
 ", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 4, "step_txt": "$$\text{In the triangle $MOQ$ and triangle $NPQ$ we have}$$
\[
	\angle \input[s1v1]{} = \angle N 
\]
\[
	\angle \input[s1v2]{} \input[s1v3]{} \input[s1v4]{} = \angle NQP 
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 4, "step_txt": " $$\text{So, by using angle angle similarity we can write $\Delta MOQ \sim \Delta NPQ $}$$
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{\input[s2v1]{} \input[s2v2]{} }{QP } = \frac{MQ }{QN } = \frac{MO }{\input[s2v3]{} \input[s2v4]{} } 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{OQ }{\input[s3v1]{} } = \frac{7 }{10 } = \frac{10 }{NP }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow OQ = \frac{7 }{\input[s3v2]{} } \times 11 = 7.7 cm
\]

And
\[
	\Rightarrow NP = \frac{\input[s3v3]{} }{7 } \times 10 = 14.29 cm
\]
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["M", "M", "Q", "O"], "text": "$$\text{Since, OM is parallel to NP, therefore, by alternate interor angle property, we have $\angle M = \angle N$, also, since vertically opposite angles are equal, therefore, $\angle MQO = \angle NQP$.}$$"}, {"data": ["O", "Q", "N", "P"], "text": "$$\text{Sice, the ratio of corresponding sides in similar triangle is proportional, therefore, $\frac{OQ }{QP } = \frac{MQ }{QN } = \frac{MO }{NP }$}$$"}, {"data": [11, 10, 10], "text": "$$\text{Putting the values in the previous equation we get $\frac{OQ }{11 } = \frac{7 }{10 } = \frac{10 }{NP }$, which upon simplification gives us $OQ = \frac{7 }{10 } \times 11 = 7.7$ cm and $NP = \frac{10 }{7 } \times 10 = 14.29$ cm}$$ "}]
